scenarioDescription:
The HD 168443 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 168443 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.51 times its radius. It is located 129.24 light years away from the solar system.

HD 168443 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 168443 system


HD 168443 b

HD 168443 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 1999-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 168443 b is 2435.562 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 168443 b is 12.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 168443 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 168443 c

HD 168443 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2001-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.84 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 168443 c is 5467.374 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 168443 c is 12.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 168443 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 168443, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 168443 - System With 2 Exolanets
